body:
Comment 4 by **mauro.dec**: 
I tested it again and 'go get' by itself seems to work. I tried to do 'go get
code.google.com/p/rsc/xmpp' and I get the following crash.

[mauro@alarmpi go]$ go get code.google.com/p/rsc/xmpp
runtime: split stack overflow: 0xb54fcca4 < 0xb697e000
fatal error: runtime: split stack overflow

goroutine 1 [runnable]:
syscall.Syscall()
        /opt/go/src/pkg/syscall/asm_linux_arm.s:36 +0x5c
syscall.open(0x334670, 0x1c, 0xa0000, 0x0, 0x0, ...)
        /opt/go/src/pkg/syscall/zsyscall_linux_arm.go:16 +0x8c
syscall.Open(0x334670, 0x1c, 0x80000, 0x0, 0xb69b1024, ...)
        /opt/go/src/pkg/syscall/syscall_linux.go:23 +0x54
os.OpenFile(0x334670, 0x1c, 0x0, 0x0, 0x749c8, ...)
        /opt/go/src/pkg/os/file_unix.go:77 +0x60
os.Open(0x334670, 0x1c, 0x7499c, 0x0, 0x0, ...)
        /opt/go/src/pkg/os/file.go:230 +0x50
net.open(0x334670, 0x1c, 0x1, 0x0, 0x2095ec, ...)
        /opt/go/src/pkg/net/parse.go:66 +0x30
net.maxListenerBacklog(0x0)
        /opt/go/src/pkg/net/sock_linux.go:10 +0x40
net.init()
        net/_obj/_cgo_gotypes.go:-1477 +0x76c
net/http.init()
        /opt/go/src/pkg/net/http/transport.go:1009 +0x84
main.init()
        /opt/go/src/cmd/go/vet.go:37 +0xac

goroutine 2 [syscall]:

goroutine 4 [syscall]:
[fp=0xb697ef58] return()
        /opt/go/src/pkg/runtime/asm_arm.s:275
[fp=0xb697ef74] newm(0x0, 0x1066a000)
        /opt/go/src/pkg/runtime/proc.c:770 +0xa0
[fp=0xb697ef88] startm(0x1066a000, 0x0)
        /opt/go/src/pkg/runtime/proc.c:836 +0xbc
[fp=0xb697ef98] handoffp(0x1066a000)
        /opt/go/src/pkg/runtime/proc.c:854 +0x50
[fp=0xb697efa4] runtime.entersyscallblock()
        /opt/go/src/pkg/runtime/proc.c:1321 +0xa0
[fp=0xb697efc0] runtime.signal_recv(0x2)
        /opt/go/src/pkg/runtime/zsigqueue_linux_arm.c:84 +0xe8
[fp=0xb697efd8] os/signal.loop()
        /opt/go/src/pkg/os/signal/signal_unix.go:21 +0x20
[fp=0xb697efdc] runtime.goexit()
        /opt/go/src/pkg/runtime/proc.c:1214
created by os/signal.initÂ·1
        /opt/go/src/pkg/os/signal/signal_unix.go:27 +0x44

I doubt it helps, but the output of 'free' is:

             total       used       free     shared    buffers     cached
Mem:        445308     432136      13172          0      27568     294736
-/+ buffers/cache:     109832     335476
Swap:            0          0          0


and the output of 'df -h' is:

Filesystem      Size  Used Avail Use% Mounted on
/dev/root       1.8G  1.6G  128M  93% /
devtmpfs        210M     0  210M   0% /dev
tmpfs           218M     0  218M   0% /dev/shm
tmpfs           218M  260K  218M   1% /run
tmpfs           218M     0  218M   0% /sys/fs/cgroup
tmpfs           218M     0  218M   0% /tmp
/dev/mmcblk0p1   94M   24M   71M  26% /boot
/dev/sda1       147G  130G   10G  93% /mnt/extra

My working directory is the same as my GOPATH:

[mauro@alarmpi go]$ echo $GOPATH
/mnt/extra/go
